pageContext.claim: “We had to save our aluminum industry and we've done it.”
pageContext.analysis: The jury is still out on whether Trump's aluminum tariffs have helped "save" the industry. "The American aluminum industry has struggled to compete in recent years with producers in countries like China, Russia, Iceland, the United Arab Emirates and Canada that offer generous state subsidies or benefit from cheap electricity," The New York Times reported after Trump in August 2020 reimposed a 10 percent tariff on Canadian aluminum. "Today, only a handful of American aluminum smelters, which make raw aluminum out of bauxite, still operate."
